column1: Quesada is a district of the San Carlos canton
column2: in the Alajuela province of Costa Rica. It is the head city of the canton of San Carlos. Although Ciudad Quesada is the official name
column3: it is commonly referred to by the area name of San Carlos. Ciudad Quesada is also the most populous city in the canton of San Carlos.

column1: The city is the economic and political center of the region
column2: especially for the agricultural and dairy industries. The Quesada district and its surrounding areas produce about 65% of all milk in Costa Rica.

column1: Quesada has an area of 144 km² and an elevation of 656 metres. It is located at the foot of the Cordillera Central (Central Mountain Range) on the southern edge of the San Carlos Plain
column2: an expansive lowland that forms a major part of the Caribbean slope in northern Costa Rica. It is 79 km northwest of the provincial capital city of Alajuela and 90.9 km from the national capital city of San José.

column1: The city was first called La Unión
column2: which was later changed to Villa Quesada. Villa Quesada was granted the title of "Ciudad" (City) by law on July 8

The city is a major commercial center for ranching and agricultural enterprises in the surrounding area. It is known for its leather goods
column2: as well as for its dairy production. The city harbours some important manufacturing plants related to the agribusiness sector.

column1: This city harbors facilities of Costa Rica's largest dairy cooperative in order to produce cheese and powder milk. It also has a R&D center operating in the same facilities Dos Pinos.
There are several hot springs in the area
column2: some of which have developed into resorts
column3: attracting  Costa Ricans and foreign tourists.

column1: Zoológico La Marina is a private nonprofit zoo operated by the Alfaro family on five hectares of their cattle ranch. There are more than 450 species of animals and birds on display
column2: most of which were confiscated by the government from illegal private ownership. The facility also maintains a successful breeding program of tapirs
column3: an increasingly endangered species. It is 11 kilometers northeast of Ciudad Quesada on the road to Aguas Zarcas.

column1: The town's football club is A.D. San Carlos
column2: who have spent over 25 years in the Costa Rican Primera División. They play their home games at the Estadio Carlos Ugalde Álvarez.
